list.listitem: House of Brabant, a noble family from Lotharingia
Landgraviate of Brabant(10851183), a medieval county west of Brussels, a small part of thepagusincluding the rivers Zender, Senne and Dijle, became part of the larger Duchy of Brabant in 1183
Duchy of Brabant(11831795), a duchy of the Holy Roman Empire (11831556), Burgundian Netherlands (14301482), Habsburg Netherlands (14821581), and Southern Netherlands (15811795)
Province of BrabantSouth Brabant(1815-1830), part of the United Kingdom of the Netherlands, became part of Belgium in 1830 along with Central Brabant (Antwerp province)
Province of Brabant(1830-1995), central province of Belgium centred on Brussels
Province of Brabant, which in 1995 was split up into two provinces and an autonomous region:Flemish Brabant, in the Flanders regionWalloon Brabant, in the Wallonia regionBrussels-Capital Region
Klein-Brabant, the municipalities Bornem, Puurs and Sint-Amands in the Antwerp province of Flanders region
East Brabant, orHageland, an area east of Brussels between the cities of Leuven, Aarschot, Diest and Tienen
Brabant-en-Argonne, commune in the Meuse department
Brabant-le-Roi, commune in the Meuse departmentBrabant-ls-Villers (1973-1982), former commune, amalgamation of Brabant-le-Roi andVillers-aux-Vents
Port Brabant, former name of Tuktoyaktuk, Canada
Le Morne Brabant, a mountain on Mauritius
Brabant (or Brabanon), other names for theBelgian (horse)
Brabantian, a dialect that formed the basis of the Dutch language
HNLMS Noord-Brabant('North Brabant'), several ships of the Dutch navy
